title: Bug 3970 - Preferences: UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files
description: Bug 3970 - Preferences: UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX). Windows workstations are used as X terminals to run Eclipse, as they are more cost-effective than Unix boxes.
OB: When creating a new file, we currently use the line delimiter returned from System.getProperties('line.delimiter'). But this is not what a user always wants.
EB: Even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters since the end product is a Unix application. There should be a UI (Preference) to define the line delimiter for new files. Possible values are Dos / Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. The UI should be provided by the Workbench since all plugins should use the same line delimiter for new files.
SR:
1. Open Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Go to the 'Preferences' menu.
3. Look for the 'Line Delimiters' section in the preferences.
4. Select the desired line delimiter option (Dos / Windows, Mac, Unix, or default platform).
5. Create a new file.
6. Observe that the new file uses the selected line delimiter as defined in the preferences.
